formattedAddress: 168 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 168 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009-4646, USA

editorialSummary.text: Small, easygoing bar & community event space featuring seasonal cocktails & a backyard beer garden.

originalText.text: According to the owner, “Lucky is a comfortable neighborhood bar, delightfully douche-free, with a warm, whip-smart staff that doesn’t suffer fools.” Well, I made a trip to East Village just to check this spot out, and I must say I will never return! The bartender, Tracy, was the biggest “douche” in the place. She was slamming stuff around and very rude to me multiple times. Save yourself the time and go around the corner to 11th street bar… much nicer, good drinks, and friendly staff.

Save yourself the time and go around the corner to 11th street bar… much nicer, good drinks, and friendly staff.

originalText.text: New favourite neighbourhood bar!! Karen was amazing and whipped me up a drink that was delicious and was kind enough to lend us some cash to use for the jukebox. Love this place and will be back!!

text.text: New favourite neighbourhood bar!! Karen was amazing and whipped me up a drink that was delicious and was kind enough to lend us some cash to use for the jukebox. Love this place and will be back!!

originalText.text: Happy hour is great. Service with a smile. Nice spot.

text.text: Happy hour is great. Service with a smile. Nice spot.

originalText.text: One of the few classic nyc dive bars left. Been here on a few nights.  Saturday nights can get pretty packed, it's usually the same green haired bartender working.  Just her. Yet she makes sure every one has a drink, with very little time waiting.  She has the perfect demeanor needed to deal with rude customers that stroll on through thinking they're going to come hang out in the EV like it's second season of the Jersey Shore. Get the F outta here. Lucky is a real-life fun time.

text.text: One of the few classic nyc dive bars left. Been here on a few nights.  Saturday nights can get pretty packed, it's usually the same green haired bartender working.  Just her. originalText.text:
My two friends and I (all 23) stopped here to get a quick shot on the way to our night plans after looking up bars in the area with what looked like good reviews. We walk in and sit at the bar, the bartender comes over to get our order and asks for our IDs. One of my friends realized she didn’t have her physical ID, but she had a picture of it and she was able to use that before as acceptable form of ID in previous bars so she asked if that would suffice. The bartender said that she couldn’t accept the photo ID, which we understood and did not argue. She obviously was no longer going to get a drink anymore and my other friend and I pulled out our IDs to show the bartender and thought everything was fine after that.

A few minutes after, this older woman, who I assume is the owner, comes out yelling at my friend and demeaning her for asking if the photo of the ID would be acceptable or not. We hadn’t been asked to leave, or told that there was a problem before this, all that was said to us by the bartender was that the photo wasn’t acceptable but that it was okay for me and my other friend to order our shots (since we had our physical ID with us to show). The yelling was so loud that I told her she did not need to be screaming at us and then she started to victimize herself and say “Oh cause I’m such a c*nt, yeah I’m a c*nt” when no one had even attacked her or said anything negative to her.

It was a very shocking and honestly dehumanizing experience to have a much older white woman screaming at 3 young 23 year old POC publicly like that instead of addressing the issue in a polite and civil manner as a business owner should in this situation. She was also very visibly drunk which I think also heightened her inappropriate behavior.

We never had a issue with the bartender stating that a photo ID isn’t acceptable. If they had asked us to leave because of it, we would be more than happy to oblige. But no one said anything to us and the bartender took my and my other friend’s ID. This whole situation was just really unnecessary and I truly hope no one ever has to experience what we did here.

The target clientele for this bar is definitely catered to older white people (40-60+) and if any POC or anyone looking for basic level of decency are reading this review, I seriously think you should reconsider going here as the treatment we received was not acceptable at all.
